programme.desc: Ever wondered what gaming was like the year you were born? Or reminisced about simpler times when games spoke to you more? programme.title: Videogame Nation
programme.desc: Dan, Aoife, John and the VGN experts chart the 10 most influential titles of the 80's, a decade that saw the rise, fall and rise again of the games industry, and gave birth to some of gaming's most iconic mascots.

programme.title: Videogame Nation
programme.desc: Dan, Aoife, John and the VGN experts chart the 10 most influential games of the 90's, a decade that saw the birth of 3D, the creation of new genres and the rise of PlayStation.

programme.title: Videogame Nation
programme.desc: Dan, Aoife, John and the VGN experts chart the 10 most influential games of the 2000s, a decade that spanned three console generations, saw Microsoft enter the fray and gave us motion controls.

programme.title: Videogame Nation
programme.desc: Dan, Aoife, John and the VGN experts chart the 10 most influential games of the last 5 years: a period that's seen the success of mobile gaming, given us huge, sprawling open worlds and the most powerful generation of consoles and PCs to date.

programme.title: The Archive: 1996
programme.desc: The mid-90s was an interesting time in the gaming world. Sony had already shifted the balance of power with the release of the Playstation, and a whole host of consoles were on their last legs. But 1996 was the year that Nintendo made a stand; to unleash a double-headed beast. It was time for the N64. It was the time for Pokemon!

programme.title: The Archive: 2011
programme.desc: Skyrim, Dark Souls, Minecraft... 2011 was responsible for some huge titles, but it will also forever be associated with the Sony hack. In today's Archive, Stumpy's back again to walk you through a very tumultuous year.
